channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Coronavirus: Is UK standard for antibody tests TOO high?
item.description: A test made by Chinese manufacturer Wondfo was found by US researchers to be just 3.2 per cent less sensitive than the machine used to evaluate testing kits at the University of Oxford.

item.title: Royal confidantes of the Queen and Queen Mother share their memories of the Second World War
item.description: Several of the Queen's, 94, closest friends and royal confidantes have opened up to Tatler about their experiences across Britain throughout the Second World War.

item.title: Coronavirus US: Doctors give men oestrogen to curb inflammation
item.description: Two hospitals, in New York and California, are giving male coronavirus patients sex hormones found mainly in women to see if they reduce inflammation and the severity of the illness.

item.title: Teacher reveals her blend of fabric softener and scent boosters to create a spray
item.description: A teacher called Mina shared her hack for concocting the perfect spray which she claimed was '100x better than Febreze!' The UK-based TikTok user received 246,700 views.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Death toll hits 20,735 with 360 new fatalities
item.description: The preliminary figure - not yet confirmed by the Department of Health, which releases an official UK tally each day - would be the lowest daily death count since March 30.

item.title: Virgin Media broadband outage affects thousands
item.description: Virgin Media broadband users across the UK are reporting being unable to access the internet due to a nationwide outage.

item.title: Pentagon declassifies and officially releases three UFO videos
item.description: The Pentagon has officially released three UFO videos taken by US Navy pilots. One of the videos show the notorious 2004 Tic Tac incident that was recorded over the Pacific Ocean.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Related 'inflammatory syndrome' hits children
item.description: NHS doctors have been issued an urgent alert over a rise in the number of children needing intensive care with a coronavirus-related condition.

item.title: Boy, seven, jumps into river to save his toddler brother who slipped and fell in during family walk
item.description: Mum Kate Palmer, 31, said she was 'so grateful' that son Lucas, seven, dived in to the river near Britannia in Rhymney to rescue his brother Louis-Arthur after he accidentally slipped and fell in.

item.title: Murder probe is launched after man, 88, was found dead in a house in Surrey
item.description: Police were scrambled to the house in Bletchingley Road, Godstone, Surrey, just before 11am today.

item.title: Coronavirus possibly EIGHT times more fatal than first thought
item.description: Predictions University of California, Berkeley, researchers made based on death data out of Italy claim that a 0.5 percent fatality rate is a 'conservative' estimate for New York City.

item.title: US now has 1 million coronavirus infections
item.description: The United States now has more than one million coronavirus cases across the country - accounting for a third of the global tally - as the death toll rises to more than 55,000.

item.title: Anna Wintour sparks another online frenzy after wearing sweatpants again
item.description: The image of Anna, 70, was shared on the Vogue Instagram account, and in it she is seen jogging near her home in the Hamptons, where she is currently self-isolating with family.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Families of NHS, care staff who die to get £60k
item.description: Families of medics tragically killed by coronavirus after bravely trying to save lives will receive a £60,000 life assurance payout, Health Secretary Matt Hancock revealed tonight.

item.title: Meghan says changes would've been made if Kate Middleton was being bashed in the press
item.description: Meghan Markle told friends if Kate Middleton was constantly being bashed by the press, the royal family would have stepped in and changed its media policies.

item.title: Lung bypass machines that oxygenate blood have kept 68% of critically ill coronavirus patients alive
item.description: A new study looked at 32 critically ill COVID-19 patients who were placed on ECMO machines at nine different hospitals and found that 68% were still alive at the time of analysis.

item.title: Three dead and one left fighting for his life after weekend of bloodshed
item.description: A man in his 20s was stabbed to death in Newham, east London last night. In the West Midlands, a 31-year-old man was killed and a 16-year-old boy was left fighting for his life.

item.title: The Goonies cast reunite for Josh Gad
item.description: The cast of The Goonies were virtually reunited on Monday, thanks to Frozen star Josh Gad.

item.title: Mother-of-two transforms her garage into a colourful playroom decked with rainbows
item.description: Nicole Roberts, 25, of Newport, Shropshire, spent just £450 transforming her garage into a colourful playroom for children Lilly, four, and George, two.

item.title: Pictured family murder-attempted suicide triple stabbing in Ilford east London
item.description: This is the first picture of the family ripped apart by a devastating triple stabbing that left two children dead and their father battling for his life in Ilford, east London on Sunday.

item.title: Who is 'Lynn from Skipton'? The public ridicule No 10 for selecting soft question about hugging
item.description: Lynn from Skipton was the first non-journalist given the chance to grill ministers and health officials at the daily briefings as part of a transparency drive by Number 10.

item.title: School hall fills with 120,000 birthday cards wishing Captain Tom Moore a happy 100th birthday
item.description: NHS hero and Second World War veteran Cpt Tom Moore has received enough birthday cards to fill an entire school hall. The Bedfordshire fundraiser turns 100 on birthday and Britain has wished him well.

item.title: College student is shocked that her professor can read her 'private' conversations on Zoom
item.description: Faith, an American college student, has sent some casual and profane messages on Zoom to other classmates during class. After, her professor emailed her to say she 'can see everything.'

item.title: Italy sees lowest jump in coronavirus infections in nearly seven weeks
item.description: Italy saw 1,739 new coronavirus infections on Monday, the lowest rise in the daily cases since March 10, down from 2,324 the day before. Total cases now stand at 199,414.

item.title: Coronavirus: High proportion of young infected die from strokes
item.description: Chinese anaesthetist Dr Dong Tian, 29, died in March after suffering a stroke following a 35-day battle with COVID-19. US doctors have seen a seven-fold increase in stroke patients under 50.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Roads are jam-packed with traffic while Tubes look even busier
item.description: Photographs taken during rush hour showed queues building up on London roads including the A40 at Perivale and the A102 at Greenwich, while the M5 in Bristol and the M6 in Walsall were also busy.

item.title: One of Britain's biggest model villages could be yours for £230,000- the same as a four bed home
item.description: The miniature village is located on the coast of Bridlington, East Yorkshire and has around 200 houses- but its asking price of £230,000 is as much as a local four bedroom house.

item.title: Rape and murder case of 16-year-old girl scout Margaret 'Peggy' Beck solved 57 years after her death
item.description: Margaret 'Peggy' Beck was raped and killed at the age of 16 while at a Girl Scout Camp in Jefferson County, Colorado, U.S., in 1963. Police are seeking James Raymond Taylor, now 80 years old.

item.title: Matt Hancock announces hospitals will restart vital services including cancer care from tomorrow
item.description: Matt Hancock said that key parts of the health service, which had been paused due to doctors and nurses being transferred COVID-19-related departments, will begin seeing the most urgent cases.

item.title: BBC's adaptation of Sally Rooney's Normal People is praised for 'perfect example of consent
item.description: Intimacy coach Duchess Iphie analysed the sex scene from the second episode of BBC's Normal People, telling FEMAIL seeking consent and mutual nudity made it the perfect on-screen moment.

item.title: Coronavirus: US report identifies most accurate antibody tests
item.description: There are dozens of tests being sold to the US from manufacturers including some in China which tests the blood for antibodies that scientists hope reveal an immunity to COVID-19.

item.title: Prince Edward opens Britain's newest Nightingale facility in Bristol by video link
item.description: The Earl of Wessex, 56, speaking from his home in Bagshot Park, Surrey, praised NHS workers as he officially opened Britain's newest Nightingale hospital in Bristol.

item.title: Soldier fell to death in Swiss Alps climbing accident when rock holding his abseiling rope toppled
item.description: Lance Corporal Hayden Prince, 24 from Cambridge, was on a trip with two friends. They set out from the Hornli hut at the base camp of the Matterhorn (pictured) at 6am on June 2 last year.

item.title: Coronavirus: WHO chief berates world for not heeding warnings
item.description: Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said the UN agency had sounded the highest level of alarm over Covid-19 early on, but lamented that not all countries heeded its advice.

item.title: 'Needs affirmation': Lily Allen sparks engagement rumours with NAKED selfie
item.description: She previously joked she was on a mission to get 'banned' from Instagram when she shared a topless video last year. And Lily was back to posting risqué content as she shared a topless selfie.

item.title: Air bag triggering launches bowling ball sky high into the air video
item.description: Australian YouTubers Brett, Scott and Derek staged the stunt to demonstrate just how powerful airbags are when they launch during a car crash.

item.title: Covidiots spark rescue operation after driving combined 575 miles to dive for scallops
item.description: The friends had driven from Edinburgh in Scotland and Cornwall to meet up in Bridport, Dorset. They launched their own boat from West Bay.

item.title: Listen to 911 call made the night Johnny Depp and Amber Heard had blowout fight
item.description: DailyMail.com has obtained an anonymous 911 call made the night Johnny Depp and Amber Heard had the blowout fight that ended their 18-month marriage back in May of 2016.

item.title: Underwater noise pollution from ships plummets during the coronavirus lockdown
item.description: Researchers studying the changes off of the coast of Canada have called the reduction in shipping something akin to a 'giant human experiment'.

item.title: Shocking moment prisoner falls from jail roof in Argentina during riot over coronavirus protection
item.description: Nicolás Cardozo broke a leg when he fell while inmates tried to lift him to the roof of Devoto Prison in Buenos Aires last Friday. Prisoners rioted to demand better protection against COVID-19.

item.title: Apple to delay production of its 2020 iPhones by one month due to the coronavirus pandemic
item.description: A report states that Apple is pushing back the production of its flagship 2020 iPhones about a month due to the coronavirus, but the tech giant is also set to release four new handsets.

item.title: San Francisco in the 1918 flu pandemic is a warning against lifting lockdown too soon
item.description: San Francisco ended its lockdown after just a month of closing public gatherings and ordering members of the public to wear masks. As a result, its case and death count more than doubled.

item.title: US Army reservist at center of Chinese conspiracy theories claiming SHE brought the virus to Wuhan
item.description: Maatje Benassi and her husband Matt described the 'nightmare' of their ordeal to CNN, saying their lives have been turned upside down since the theory began spreading on social media.

item.title: Killer coronavirus lingers in the air of crowded spaces and rooms that lack ventilation
item.description: Experts in Wuhan, China, analysed air samples from different parts of two hospitals. Results showed the virus was undetectable everywhere except two areas 'prone to crowding'.

item.title: Nuisance 999 caller is jailed for 16 weeks
item.description: John Williamson, 52, from Fenton, Staffordshire, rang the emergency number on at least 37 occasions - with some calls lasting longer than 20 minutes.

item.title: Brits are considering swapping social media for letters and cards, study suggests
item.description: Brit are re-embracing traditional forms of communication such as sending cards and letters at the expense of social media posts, a new survey suggests.

item.title: Could missing Luke Durbin, who disappeared in 2006, be living hostage from drug dealers in Brixton?
item.description: Luke Durbin, 19, from Ipswich, disappeared in 2006, with detectives revealing in a new Channel 5 documentary how they believe he could have been kidnapped and murdered in London.

item.title: InsePAWrable! Golden retriever brothers show their heartwarming bond
item.description: Golden-brown Kiko, eight, and five-year-old Watson, from Spokane, Washington, were introduced to each other in June 2015. Owner Jennifer Medrano, 26, documents their bond.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: One minute's silence for NHS dead on Tuesday
item.description: Boris Johnson, who battled the illness himself, including a spell in intensive care, will observe the minute's silence on Tuesday at 11am. Government workers will be asked to take part.

item.title: Five prison staff have died of coronavirus in the UK Justice Secretary Robert Buckland reveals
item.description: So far 293 prison workers in jails across Britain have contracted the virus and 321 inmates, as of 5pm on Saturday. Prison officer Rachael Yates, 33, (pictured) died last Monday.

item.title: Stockholm 'could achieve herd immunity in May': Claim by Swedish ambassador to the US
item.description: Karin Ulrika Olofsdotter, the country's ambassador to the US, told the US's National Public Radio (NPR) that 'about 30 per cent of people in Stockholm have reached a level of immunity.'

item.title: Frontline carer, 56, dies with coronavirus after his partner made him a father for the 11th time
item.description: Garry Melia decided to start looking after the elderly when the pandemic struck after his job as a DJ and chef in Southport, Liverpool ended.

item.title: Genetic make-up could make you more susceptible to coronavirus
item.description: Genetics explain 50 per cent of key COVID-19 symptoms, early research suggests based on tracking app data -- including fever, fatigue and loss of smell and taste.

item.title: Hyperloop network connecting Amsterdam and Paris could be running by 2028 says Hardt Hyperloop
item.description: Dutch company Hardt Hyperloop is developing the technology, which involves a pod that floats using magnetic levitation being pushed through a steel tube maintained at a partial vacuum.

item.title: Queen Letizia of Spain observes a minute of silence for the victims of coronavirus
item.description: Queen Letizia of Spain, 47, joined King Felipe VI today for a visit to the 112 Emergency Center in Madrid. The couple observed a minute of silence in tribute to the victims of coronavirus.

item.title: Huge police operation is underway in woodland beauty spot to find missing 16-year-old
item.description: Rawan Hussain was last seen at her house in Chapel Allerton at around 5am yesterday. Police officers are now combing Gledhow Valley Woods, a mile from her home, as part of the search.

item.title: Elderly couple recovering from coronavirus after improving when they were moved next to each other
item.description: Michael David Blessington, who has lung cancer, and his wife, Mary, who struggles with asthma, were admitted to Bradford Royal Infirmary within hours of one another on April 25.

item.title: Deliveroo rider taking food and medicine to residents fined £50 for cycling through pedestrian zone
item.description: Ethan Bradley claims he was manhandled by a Police Community Support Officer, who was 'confrontational' and not wearing PPE when handing out the £50 fine in York earlier in April.

item.title: Boris Johnson back at work amid calls for coronavirus exit plan
item.description: In a statement in Downing Street, the PM assured the country he is back in charge after weeks recuperating from a serious scare with the killer disease.

item.title: Cops blast lockdown rules that 'make no sense'
item.description: B&Q's decision to reopen 130 stores saw massive queues forming outside its outlets in Watford (pictured), Edinburgh, Bristol and Swansea, as people used the shutdown to catch up on DIY.

item.title: Kim Jong Un sends letter to South African President Cyril Ramaphosa despite death rumours April 27
item.description: Kim Jong Un is reported to have written to South African President Cyril Ramaphosa to congratulate him on the country's Freedom Day, a national holiday.

item.title: Incredible images of the world's most stunning sinkholes, from Oregon to Croatia via the Bahamas
item.description: MailOnline Travel has scoured the globe for eye-popping images of the world's most jaw-dropping abysses - from stunning marine sinkholes to dizzingly colossal shafts on land.

item.title: Unseen pictures explore life on board the colossal hospital ship HMHS Britannic
item.description: His Majesty's Hospital Ship (HMHS) Britannic sunk in 55 minutes on 21 November 1916. It was larger than the Titanic but went down faster as the engines were accelerated in an attempt to beach it.

item.title: Horrified mother-of-one, 36, finds dirty blue surgical glove inside sealed pack of potatoes
item.description: Mother-of-one Biba Kutisova, 36, from Salisbury, set about immediately washing the potatoes to avoid any possible contamination from coronavirus.

item.title: Streamers can now charge people to watch their videos on Facebook
item.description: Facebook will let users charge viewers for access to live video streams as part of the company's efforts to help people make up for lost income during the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: Airbus furloughs 3,200 UK staff
item.description: Workers at the Broughton factory in Wales will be furloughed and the company will apply for the Government's job retention scheme. Airbus will top up salaries to bring total up to 85-90 per cent of pay.

item.title: Somerset NHS Trust becomes first to prioritise black and ethnic minority staff for facemasks
item.description: Somerset Foundation Trust is treating its black, Asian and minority ethnic staff as 'vulnerable' to coronavirus after research showed they have been disproportionately affected by the virus,

item.title: Fertility patients can now freeze embryos, eggs and sperm for an extra two years
item.description: Ministers do not want patients to be 'unfairly caught out' after procedures were paused earlier this month due to Covid-19.

item.title: Supply teacher sexually assaulted six girls as young as seven in just 21 days
item.description: Jonathan Clayton from Carlton in County Durham was described as 'weird' and 'creepy' by his victims after he assaulted girls aged between seven and 11.

item.title: Coronavirus survivors donate blood plasma rich in antibodies
item.description: NHS Blood and Transplant (NHSBT) photos show former patients (pictured, Laura Martin in Tooting, London) making the donation in a process known as plasmapheresis.

item.title: Three arrested, including a man and women in their 60s, in murder probe of 32-year-old sex worker
item.description: Police conducting a murder investigation following the disappearance of Natalie Jenkins, 32, from Middlesbrough, North Yorkshire, have arrested three people.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Small businesses to get 'bounce-back' loans
item.description: Chancellor Rishi Sunak unveiled the provision in the Commons in the latest escalation of the massive bailouts for firms hit by the coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: Skincare expert reveals how to plump your pout with massage technique not fillers
item.description: New York-based esthetician Danna Omari shared a video on TikTok in which she revealed how to massage your lips to make them naturally fuller.

item.title: Boris Johnson 'presented a fighter's stance' as he addressed nation two weeks after leaving hospital
item.description: The Prime Minister is back at work and addressed the nation from Downing Street where he labelled coronavirus an 'invisible mugger' after his own personal experience facing off the deadly illness.

item.title: Poorest pupils 'will miss out most due to the coronavirus shutdown'
item.description: Amanda Spielman said the chaos caused by the killer disease is going to present the 'biggest problem for the poorest, the lowest-achieving academically and the least motivated children'.

item.title: Households with pensioners are most likely to have stockpiled items
item.description: Households with pensioners are the most likely to have stockpiled ready for a disaster, with items such as bottled water, tinned food and a back-up generator.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: THREE YEARS until economy back to 2019 levels
item.description: Forecasting group the EY Item Club warned that the UK will face a 'deep, short recession' this year,, amid mounting calls for ministers to spell out an 'exit strategy' from the lockdown.

item.title: Switzerland and Norway start to leave coronavirus lockdown
item.description: Swiss shoppers were returning to garden centres and hair salons today (pictured here in Villeneuve) as the army prepares to hand out a million masks a day to shops and businesses.

item.title: Are these Britain's most beautiful rooms?
item.description: Interior design company Cox & Cox ran a competition to highlight the array of interior design talent in UK - with a contemporary and stylish home bar winning first place.

item.title: Michael Gove says coronavirus should 'concentrate the minds' of the EU on post-Brexit trade talks
item.description: The Cabinet Office Minister, who is politically in charge of talks, also reiterated the UK's belief that the December 31 deadline for the UK to leave the EU's sphere of influence.

item.title: Tom Hardy returns to CBeebies Bedtime Stories series
item.description: Fans of Tom Hardy, 42, have taken to Twitter to share their excitement ahead of the British actor's return to CBeebies Bedtime stories this evening.

item.title: Emma Watson's mystery 'boyfriend' revealed as Leo Robinton who's a business owner from California
item.description: Emma Watson's new 'boyfriend' is a Californian business owner called Leo Alexander Robinton, MailOnline can exclusively reveal.

item.title: Doctor with coronavirus falls to her death from hospital in Russia
item.description: Natalya Lebedeva had been accused of failing to stop an outbreak of Covid-19 inside the restricted Star City (file phot) where cosmonauts are trained, colleagues claimed.

item.title: Age gap couples reveal their stories
item.description: Age gap couples from around the world have shared their stories online to break the negative stereotypes around their age difference.

item.title: Daughter replaces family portraits with crayon drawings one by one and not one family member notices
item.description: Kristen Vloger, from Massachusetts, played a funny prank on her parents during lockdown - by replacing their family portraits one by one with crayons drawings. It took them 11 days to notice.

item.title: Loyal dog 'waits for its owner outside their home for THREE YEARS after being abandoned'
item.description: The pet is said to have waited day and night in a residential complex where it and its owner used to live in China. It is said that its owner went back to South Korea without saying good-bye to it.

item.title: Man, 53, who triggered armed police siege arrested 15 hours later over 'threats to kill'
item.description: Officers were called to an address on Birmingham Road at 10.30pm last night following reports of a 'firearms incident'. A 53-year-old man has been arrested after a 15-hour siege.

item.title: Arsenal stars pictured training in isolation as they come back from coronavirus lockdown
item.description: Remarkable aerial images have been taken showing Arsenal's players training on one pitch each at the club's Colney base in their first session back after coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: Chinese children must wear 'one-metre hats' to keep social distancing as they return to school
item.description: A video showed the children wearing their home-made 'one-metre hats' with extended sticks on both sides to remain safe distance with their classmates at a school in Zhejiang province, China.

item.title: Scientists are cultivating glow-in-the-dark flowers by inserting DNA from bioluminescent mushrooms
item.description: A global team of researchers, funded by biotech startup Planta, found that the bioluminescence in some mushrooms is similar natural processes in plants.

item.title: Hilarious moment homeowner yells 'hello' at a burglar through a smart doorbell during break-in
item.description: Steven Hewes, 60, had already ransacked the house in Kimberley, Notts, but triggered a doorbell motion camera when he returned to the property and immediately started to scramble for excuses.

item.title: NHS Nightingales barely used due to lack of equipment to treat severe coronavirus cases
item.description: Experts have alleged the reason why only dozens of people are being treated in the temporary wards set up in warehouses and exhibition centres is because they lack staff and equipment.

item.title: NHS worker, 51, died in her husband's arms struggling for breath due to coronavirus
item.description: Locality administrator Laura Tanner, 51, passed away at home in Basildon, Essex, as she waited with husband Kevin (pictured together) for paramedics.

item.title: AirAsia unveils cabin crew coronavirus uniform... complete with mask, visor and BOILER SUIT
item.description: Passengers will be attended to by stewards clad head to toe in personal protective equipment when some flights restart on April 29.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 'Greedy' holiday home owners claim £50m bailout
item.description: Five thousand lets have claimed £10,000 each from the fund in Cornwall (pictured, St Ives), which was set up to help minor firms survive the coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: New Zealand has won a battle against virus transmission: PM
item.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern on Monday claimed New Zealand had scored a significant victory against the spread of the coronavirus.

item.title: Remains of a Bronze Age chieftain are unearthed in Gloucestershire
item.description: Archaeologists made the 'unprecedented discovery' during a dig in Lechlade, Gloucestershire on the site of a future skatepark and memorial hall.

item.title: PIERS MORGAN: An open letter to President Trump from his (now unfollowed) friend: cut the covid crap
item.description: I used very forceful language to convey my dismay at such reckless, shocking and woefully irresponsible behavior. And for that, I make no apology.

item.title: Naomie Harris, Fearne Cotton and Matin Clunes launch Macmillan Cancer appeal after 50% income drop
item.description: Johnny Vegas, Larry Lamb, Kimberley Walsh and more appeared in the video. Macmillan is losing out as shops close and fundraising events cancel during the nationwide lockdown.

item.title: Virgin Atlantic air stewardess, 36, takes job stacking shelves at Asda after being furloughed
item.description: Cabin crew member Sara, who lives in Brighton, is used to flying across the world but is now stacking chilled food at the store in Lancing, West Sussex after being furloughed by the struggling airline.

item.title: Laurence Fox and Richard Ayoade fell out after Question Time
item.description: Laurence Fox has revealed his half-Kuwaiti girlfriend Sara McKinnon dumped him over his controversial race rant on Question Time in January.

item.title: Lib Dem councillor apologises after tweeting picture of a plate of BACON
item.description: Ian Manning, a county councillor in Cambridgeshire, took part in 'Lib Dem Iftar' - a scheme where Liberal Democrats fasted alongside Muslims for one day on Saturday.

item.title: Last chance to open a Nationwide account offering 5% interest
item.description: From the start of May, 5% savings deals will be as dead as a dinosaur, with Nationwide cutting FlexDirect from 5% to 2% and lowering the balance you can earn interest on. But you can sign up now.

item.title: SAGE warned the Government 'very early on' that care homes were at risk of COVID-19
item.description: Sir Patrick Vallance, the UK's chief scientific adviser, said today that the group of scientists tasked with digesting evidence for the Government told officials months ago about the risk to care homes.

item.title: Indonesian fired for claiming women could fall pregnant by swimming where men with had ejaculated
item.description: Sitti Hikmawatty, a member of Indonesia's child protection commission, made the comments in an interview about teenage pregnancy in February.

item.title: While many Covid-19 victims die alone, one Dutch paramedic is granting terminally-ill dying wishes
item.description: Dutch ambulance driver Kees Veldboer, 60, who has helped to fulfil the dying wishes of more than 14,000 patients, has been able to continue his work despite the coronavirus crisis.
item.media:credit: Caters News Agency/@Stichting Ambulance Wens Nederland

item.title: Riz Ahmed reveals he has lost two family members to coronavirus
item.description: Venom actor and rapper Riz Ahmed said he hopes the surge of appreciation for the NHS draws attention to prejudice against the ethnic minorities that keep it running.

item.title: Harry helps launch mental fitness tool for the military
item.description: The Duke of Sussex, 35, has appeared in a video on HeadFIT.org, urging members of the armed forces to train their `mind and body as one´ in order to launch a new mental fitness tool.

item.title: Another 13 migrants, including a toddler, arrive at Dover - as total for April surges beyond 400
item.description: Another 13 migrants, including a toddler, have arrived in the UK after a huge search and rescue operation was launched earlier today. The migrants were spotted in a boat off the Kent coast.

item.title: Baby girl pulls on the same spotty dress her mother wore 31 years ago
item.description: Rebecca Ellis-Dunsten, 31, from Newton Abbot, Devon, was just a baby herself when she wore the dress for a family photoshoot in 1989 - but it was feared to be long gone.

item.title: Drawings of woolly mammoths and rhinos at least 15,000 years old
item.description: Etchings of woolly mammoths and rhinoceros in Mongolia and Russia were made some 7,000 years older than previously thought, researchers say.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Home-testing website to order kits runs out for FOURTH day in row
item.description: More than ten million essential workers and their households are now eligible for Covid-19 checks as officials race to hit their 100,000-a-day tests target by Thursday.

item.title: Shocking moment shopper headbutts rival outside Co-op store in Poole
item.description: Footage shows a man in a black polo shirt squaring up to a younger man in a white T-shirt who was allegedly threatening staff at a store in Poole, Dorset.

item.title: Ancient Britons were among the first Europeans to shift to dairy farming
item.description: Scientists from the University of York tracked the shift from hunter-gatherer lifestyles to early farming in prehistoric Europe over about 1,500 years.

item.title: Farmer discovers an extremely rare spider with a freaky 'stamp' on its abdomen
item.description: The 'unbelievable' arachnid is a Chinese hourglass spider and extremely rare, according to an expert. Chinese hourglass spiders don't spin webs. Instead, they live in underground nests.

item.title: Carole Middleton delivers goody bags filled with toys to her local hospital's children's ward
item.description: Carole Middleton, 65, delivered goody bags filled with toys to a local hospital's children ward on Saturday. The photograph is believed to have been shared on her company Party Pieces Instagram.

item.title: Are Britons still up for farm work as farmers cry out for pickers?
item.description: British farms need workers to help pick fruit, vegetables and salads. We spoke to farmers to find out why, despite a wave of interest, so few are taking jobs.

item.title: NHS nurse, 54, who battled coronavirus in same intensive care ward as Boris Johnson dies
item.description: Care home nurse Larni Zuniga, 54, was a married father originally from the Philippines who had worked in Britain for 12 years and had not seen his family for five years.

item.title: Violent and controlling thug left his Tinder-date ex, 31, needing 30 stitches
item.description: Lucy Jackson-Stifanese, from Essex, met Ben Robertson, 36, on Tinder and moved in with him very quickly. He abused her many times, leaving her naked on the balcony and needing stitches.

item.title: Ricky Gervais says social media breeds 'uber narcissism'
item.description: RIcky Gervais, 56, made the comments on Fearne Cotton's Happy Place podcast. He said: 'Social media is like being able to read every toilet wall at once.'

item.title: Nurse, 21, says acne was so severe she wore makeup in bed with her boyfriend
item.description: Ellie Rutland-Jones, 21, from from Swadlincote, Derbyshire, who would wear makeup in bed to hide her spots from her own boyfriend has praised a controversial drug for improving her skin.

item.title: Van Der Valk viewers say it lacks the 'charm' of the original 1970s series
item.description: Van der Valk, a cool, slightly arrogant detective, now played by Hustle star Marc Warren instead of the late Barry Foster, solves serious crimes in Amsterdam.

item.title: Germany abandons its own coronavirus contact-tracing strategy in favour of 'decentralised' approach
item.description: German Chancellery Minister Helge Braun and Health Minister Jens Spahn said in a joint statement that Berlin would adopt a "decentralised" approach to digital tracing.

item.title: Boots worker with scoliosis wins £7,000 after new boss banned her twice-daily 15-minute tea breaks
item.description: Pharmacy technician Natalie Williams, who had worked at the Boots store in Holyhead for 34 years, suffered from painful scoliosis but new boss Amy Wilber removed her twice-daily tea breaks.

item.title: Tiny sedge warbler taunts a cuckoo twice his size in this year's best nature photograph
item.description: A stunning shot of a cuckoo being taken on by a tiny warbler in York has won the Society of International Nature and Wildlife Photographers' Living World competition.

item.title: Primates viewers marvel as a lion-tailed macaque SLAPS a Malabar giant squirrel eating jackfruit
item.description: Viewers of the BBC One show were gobsmacked when a lion-tailed Macaque repeatedly slapped a giant Malabar squirrel trying to eat the same 1-kg jackfruit in Indonesia..

item.title: Moment Porbeagle shark stalks two British fishermen circling off the Channel Islands
item.description: Brandon La Touche and Paris Broe-Bougourd got excited when their fish-finder gave off a large reading just off Guernsey, only to then be greeted by a scene which looked fresh out of a Jaws film.

item.title: Ssh! People reveal why they've kept their relationships a secret from friends and family
item.description: People from around the world have taken to anonymous sharing app Whisper, to confess they're in secret relationships and reveal why they won't tell their friends, family or work colleagues.

item.title: Former tennis prodigy once linked to Nick Kyrgios convicted of drug driving
item.description: Former tennis prodigy Monique Belovukovic, appeared in court for sentencing after she pleaded guilty to driving with an illicit drug present in her bloodstream/oral fluids last month.

item.title: Man, 20, is killed and boy, 16, is fighting for life after separate knife attacks
item.description: Police arrested a 14-year-old boy on suspicion of attempted murder after the attack on Chapelhouse Road in Solihull at around 2.40pm today.

item.title: Husband is arrested for murder of his professor wife who went missing after she was scared of him
item.description: Police charged the husband of Ella Diebolt Jackson, 48, in her disappearance. Glenn Jackson, 39, from Kentucky was arrested Friday and charged with murder-domestic violence.

item.title: Chef Rob Nixon shares two-ingredient chocolate cake recipe which can be made from eggs and Nutella
item.description: Perth chef Rob Nixon whipped up the indulgent dessert in a TikTok video last Tuesday, calling it 'cheap and easy to make, but delicious' to taste.

item.title: Home cook shares her mouthwatering recipe for fluffy cream cheese rolls
item.description: A delighted home baker from Australia has shared photos and the recipe for her cream cheese soft rolls online, wowing thousands with the simple method.

item.title: British 'ISIS rapper' was caught in Spain after he was identified by his EARS as he hid behind mask
item.description: British 'ISIS rapper' Abdel-Majed Abdel Bary was identified by his ears after sneaking into Spain by boat, it emerged today. Bary, 29, took advantage of coronavirus lockdown to hide behind a face mask.
